text:
I had often changed what I wanted do when I was
young, teacher to be like my sister, nurse to be like my mother. I changed each
year what I wanted to do but one day I found my voice , and finally I found
what I want to do, I want to be a journalist. To be this person that everyone
watched on their TV each night, this person which tells what
happened in the world. As a matter of fact, the journalist’ profession is a
profession made to me, travel through the world, interview different people across
the world is something that I like so much.
I remembered when I was kid; my sister and I must watch the news on TV
with my parents because they considered that it was very important for them
that we knew what happened in the world.
Moreover, I’ve always be inspire by all these journalist sent on the
action place, living in live what happened and sometimes it is in a difficult
time of the country like the war in Paris but they have never show that they
are sacred and it’s that to be a journalist or a reporter it’s to be here to tell
what happened to rest of the world, it’s to risk our life to the other in order
to say what the world looks like nowadays. To put it in a nutshell, there is
one place in particular where I want go to work and it’s here all importance of
English because I have always want to work in United-Kingdom, I love this
country, the culture, the people and the
country in itself. Work in the BBC studio will be the most beautiful
accomplishment in my life. They are always here in special moment of the
United-Kingdom like for example  there
are a view days ago when Alex Dupont died or during the 2012’ JO
there was 10 years.  It’s all of that
which inspires me in my daily life since view years and I hope that later when
I will work in BBC studios I inspire other people, other young to become in
their turn journalist.
